695718-d-01-17-11-DMIR.Maintenance Railroad Name: Duluth, Missabe & Iron Range Railway Company
695718-d-01-17-11-DMIR.Narrative: A43981-17 DERAILED 2 CARS ON THE SOUTH END OF PROCTOR YARD PULLING OUT TRACK PF02 TO MAKE THEIR DOUBLE TO TRACK PF03. INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT WHILE SWITCHING IN THE YARD, THE CREW ON R92481-16 HAD DOUBLED TRACKS PE06 AND PE02 THAT HAD 39 CARS IN THE TRACK. THE CONDUCTOR MADE THE JOINT ON PF02 AND SENT THE BRAKEMAN TO THE SOUTH END TO PROTECT THE SHOVE. THE BRAKEMAN DROVE TO THESOUTH END OF THE YARD NORTHWARD BETWEEN PF03 AND PF02 TO THE POINT OF THE MOVEMENT. ONCE IN POSITION, HE GOT OF THE TRUCK AND DROVE ALONG SIDE THE POINT TO PROTECT. THE CONDUCTOR ON THE NORTH END COMMUNICATED HE NEEDED 40 CAR LENGTHS TO SPOT THE TRACK AT AIR ON THE NORTH END. THE BRAKEMAN PROTECTEDTJE SHOVE TO THE SOUTH END OF THE YARD GIVING CAR COUNTS TO SPOT THE TRACK AT AIR. WHEN THE CREW ONA43981-17 STARTED TO PULLTHE CARS OUT OF TRACK PF02, CNLX 6147 AND AEX 13585 DERAILED. NAHX 316714 WAS NOT DERAILED BUT DAMAGED. IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE CREW ON R92481-16 HAD RUN THRU THE SWITCH AND WHEN A43891-17 PULLED THE TRACK, THEY PULLED BACK THRU THE SWITCH DERAILING THE CARS.

696297-d-01-22-11-IC.Narrative: L50071-22 WAS IN THE PROCESS OF HUMPING CARS IN HARRISON YARD WHEN THEY HUMPED A CUT OF 2 EMPTY TANKCARS (PPNX 1198 AND GATX 202721) TO TRACK MO24. THEY THEN HUMPED AN ADDITIONAL 2 CARS TO TRACK MO25. THE FIRST CUT OF CARS STOPPED IN THE FOUL OF H-1 OF THE KING  SWITCH AND THE SECOND SET OF CARS, WITH UTLX 667105, CORNERED THE PREVIOUS CUT. INVESTIGATION INTO THE INCIDENT FOUND THAT PPNX 1198 HADA FAULTY SLACK ADJUSTER THAT DID NOT ALLOW THE BRAKE SHOES TO RELEASE FROM THE WHEELS WHEN THE AIRBRAKES WERE BLED OFF THUS CAUSING THE CARS TO STALL AT THE HILL CAUSING A CORNERING INCIDENT WHEN ADDITIONAL CARS WERE HUMPED. NO LEAKS, SPILL OR INJURIES ARE INVOLVED.

D660111-d-01-04-11-ABS.Primary Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Transverse/compound fissure   [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Prev.Guides]
D660111-d-01-04-11-ABS.Accident Cause: Broken Rail - Transverse/compound fissure   [Desc.Changed-Refer to Current/Prev.Guides]
D660111-d-01-04-11-ABS.Narrative: ABSR 222 CREW TRAVELING EASTBOUND ON 1/4/2011. SHORTLY AFTER CLEARING THE KCS PROPERTY AT MP 17 THEYSTARTED UP THE GRADE AT EST. 10 MPH. WHEN JUST PAST MP 19 THE ENGINEER FELT A SLIGHT TUG AND THEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY. CONDUCTOR STARTED WALKING THE TRAIN WHEN HE NOTICED THE 20TH THROUGH THE 31ST CARS HAD DERAILED. THE 20TH CAR WAS LEANING TO THE SOUTH SIDE OF THE RAIL, THEN THE 21ST THROUGH THE 29TH CARS ARE ON THEIR SIDE IN THE DITCH, AND THE 30TH IS RESTING ON THE WHEELS AT A 45 DEGREE ANGLE. IT WAS AT THIS TIME HE NOTICES THAT THE 27TH – 29TH CARS WERE HAZMAT. HE IMMEDIATELY MADEHIS WAY BACK TOWARD THE HEAD END AND CONTACTED ABSR MANAGEMENT. AFTER INVESTIGATION IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE RAIL BROKE UNDER LOAD ON THE SOUTH RAIL.  MANAGEMENT STAFF FOUND A TRANSVERSE FISSURE INTHIS RAIL.  NO SUCH DEFECTS WERE FOUND WHEN NORDCO INSPECTED THIS LOCATION BACK IN SEPTEMBER OF 2010. COSTS FOR THIS DERAILMENT WILL BE THE RESPONSIBLITY OF NORDCO FOR FAILING TO TAKE ACTION  OR NOTIFY THE ABS WHEN THE DEFECT WAS DETECTED

694701-d-01-06-11-GTW.Narrative: L50261-06 WAS DEPARTING DURAND TRAVELING EASTBOUND AT APPROX. 5 MPH ON MAIN TWO WHEN IT WENT INTO EMERGENCY. AFTER INSPECTING THE TRAIN IT WAS FOUND THAT 12 CARS WERE DERAILED ON THE MAIN LINE. THREEOF WHICH ARE ON THEIR SIDES. A TOTAL OF 10 HAZARDOUS CARS WERE DERAILED, 2 OF THE DERAILED CARS LEAKED APPROX. 947 GALLONS OF HYDROCHLORIC ACID. THERE WAS AN EVACUATION OF 72 PEOPLE THAT LASTED APPROX. 22 HOURS. THE CARS INVOLVED WERE GATX 60995 (APPROX. 10 GALLON LOSS) AND GATX 61247 (APPROX. 937 GALLON LOSS). IT WAS FOUND THAT THE DERAILMENT WAS DUE TO IMPROPER USE OF THE INDEPENDENT BRAKE. CREWWAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.  FURTHER INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT THE DERAILMENT ACTUALLYOCCURRED BEFORE THE CREW MADE THEIR SET-OUT AT DURAND AND DEPARTED WHEN THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY.  IT WAS FOUND THAT THE INITIAL EVENT OCCURRED WHEN THE TRAIN WAS ARRIVING IN THE YARD AND THE ENGINEER MADE 2 FULL STOPS PRIOR TO BEGINNING HIS WORK AT DURAND.  THE CREW THEN CUT OFF THEIR TRAIN,DID THEIR WORK IN DURAND AND RETURNED TO THE TRAIN FINDING THE CARS DERAILED WHEN THEY ATTEMPTED TOPULL OUT.

0111LV002-d-01-06-11-UP.Narrative: QEWLI-05, AT MP542 ON THE BEAUMONT SUB, WAS HIT BY THE DRAGGING EQUIPMENT DETECTOR AND EXPERIENCED AN UNDESIRED EMERGENCY.  UPON INSPECTION OF HIS TRAIN THE CONDUCTOR DISCOVERED THE UTLX68861 30 CARSFROM THE HEAD END, WITH ONE WHEEL REMAINING UNDER THE LEADING END OF THE CAR.  THE TRUCK ASSEMBLY HAD COME APART AND LAY STREWN ALONG THE RIGHT OF WAY.  THE SECOND WHEEL HAD KICKED OUT FROM UNDER THECAR BREAKING A PIECE OF RAIL IN THE SIDING TURNOUT AND HAD COME TO REST IN THE SIDING.  UPON FURTHERINSPECTION BY MECHANICAL FORCES IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE BOLSTER HAD CRACKED AND SPLIT IN HALF CAUSING THE FAILURE.  RAIL = CWR
